io.hekate.messaging

Interface Message<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Base type of the message payload.
    All Superinterfaces:
    MessageBase<T>

    public interface Message<T>
extends MessageBase<T>
    Message with arbitrary payload.

    This interface represents a message that was received by a MessagingChannel and provides methods for sending responses.

    For more information about messaging please see the MessagingService documentation.

    See Also:
    MessageReceiver

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isRequest()
      Returns true if this message represents a request and can be replied.
      boolean isRetransmit()
      Returns true if this message is a possible duplicate of another message that was received earlier and then was retransmitted by the failover logic.
      boolean isStream()
      Returns true if this message represents a stream request and supports partial responses.

    • Method Detail

      • mustReply

        boolean mustReply()
        Returns true if the sender is waiting for a response message.

        Responses can be sent back via the following methods:

        • reply(Object)
        • reply(Object, SendCallback)

        Note: Not responding on messages that have this flag set to true can result in resource leaks, since the sending side keeps track of all outstanding requests in its memory queue and releases resources only when a response is received.

        Returns:
        true if the sender is waiting for a response message.
        See Also:
        reply(Object, SendCallback)

      • reply

        void reply(T response)
    throws UnsupportedOperationException,
           IllegalStateException
        Asynchronously send back a reply and ignores the operation result.

        Calling this method will put the message into the 'replied' state and its mustReply() method will start returning false. Note that each message can be responded only once and all subsequent attempts to call this method will result in IllegalStateException.

        Any attempt to call this method on a message that doesn't support responses (i.e. message not a request) will result in IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        response - Response.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If message doesn't support responses.
        IllegalStateException - If message had already been responded (see mustReply()).

      • reply

        void reply(T response,
           SendCallback callback)
    throws UnsupportedOperationException,
           IllegalStateException
        Asynchronously sends a response and uses the specified callback for notification of the operation result.

        Calling this method will put the message into the 'replied' state and its mustReply() method will start returning false. Note that each message can be responded only once and all subsequent attempts to call this method will result in IllegalStateException.

        Any attempt to call this method on a message that doesn't support responses (i.e. message not a request) will result in IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        response - Response.
        callback - Callback for tracking completion of an operation.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If message doesn't support responses.
        IllegalStateException - If message had already been responded (see mustReply()).

      • partialReply

        void partialReply(T response)
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Asynchronously sends a partial reply in response to a stream request.

        This method provides support for streaming messages from the recipient back to the sender. For example, the sender can subscribe to a topic using the MessagingChannel.stream(Object, ResponseCallback) method, and then the recipient of such a request can start to continuously stream updates back to the sender. The subscriber will receive these updates via the ResponseCallback.onComplete(Throwable, Response) method. After the streaming is complete, the final response must be sent using the reply(Object) method.

        Note: This method can only be called for messages that were sent using the MessagingChannel.stream(Object, ResponseCallback) method (or its overloaded versions). If the message was sent by some other method, then all attempts to call this method will throw UnsupportedOperationException.

        The verification of whether a particular message supports partial replies can be performed using the isStream() method.

        Parameters:
        response - Response.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If message doesn't support partial responses (see isStream()).

      • partialReply

        void partialReply(T response,
                  SendCallback callback)
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Asynchronously sends a partial reply in response to a stream request.

        This method provides support for streaming messages from the recipient back to the sender. For example, the sender can subscribe to a topic using the MessagingChannel.stream(Object, ResponseCallback) method, and then the recipient of such a request can start to continuously stream updates back to the sender. The subscriber will receive these updates via the ResponseCallback.onComplete(Throwable, Response) method. After the streaming is complete, the final response must be sent using the reply(Object) method.

        Note: This method can only be called for messages that were sent using the MessagingChannel.stream(Object, ResponseCallback) method (or its overloaded versions). If the message was sent by some other method, then all attempts to call this method will throw UnsupportedOperationException.

        The verification of whether a particular message supports partial replies can be performed using the isStream() method.

        Parameters:
        response - Response.
        callback - Callback for tracking completion of an operation.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If message doesn't support partial responses (see isStream()).

      • isRetransmit

        boolean isRetransmit()
        Returns true if this message is a possible duplicate of another message that was received earlier and then was retransmitted by the failover logic.
        Returns:
        true if this message is a possible duplicate of a previously received message.

      • isStream

        boolean isStream()
        Returns true if this message represents a stream request and supports partial responses.
        Returns:
        true if this message represents a stream request.

      • isRequest

        boolean isRequest()
